column1: ...George Herbert Walker Bush was born at 173 Adams Street in Milton, Massachusetts, on June 12, 1924, to Prescott Sheldon Bush and Dorothy (Walker) Bush.  The Bush family moved from Milton to Greenwich  , Connecticut, shortly after his birth.  Growing up, his nickname was "Poppy"...

...Bush, who became the 43rd President of the United States.  Prior to his sons presidency, he was simply referred to as George Bush or President Bush. Bush was born in Milton, Massachusetts, to Prescott Bush and Dorothy Walker Bush...

...Prior to his sons presidency, he was simply referred to as George Bush or President Bush. Bush was born in Milton, Massachusetts, to Prescott Bush and Dorothy Walker Bush.  Following the attack on Pearl Harbor in 1941, Bush postponed his university studies, enlisted in the U. S...

...Bush was born in Milton, Massachusetts, to Prescott Bush and Dorothy Walker Bush.  Following the attack on Pearl Harbor in 1941, Bush postponed his university studies, enlisted in the U. S.  Navy on his 18th birthday, and became the youngest aviator in the U. S...

...The Bush family moved from Milton to Greenwich , Connecticut, shortly after his birth.  Growing up, his nickname was "Poppy".  Bush began his formal education at the Greenwich Country Day School in Greenwich...
